{{cpp/io/basic_ios/title|rdbuf}}
{{cpp/io/basic_ios/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num = 1|
std::basic_streambuf&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;* rdbuf() const;
}}
{{dcl|num = 2|
std::basic_streambuf&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;* rdbuf( std::basic_streambuf&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;* sb );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Manages the associated stream buffer.

@1@ Returns the associated stream buffer. If there is no associated stream buffer, returns a null pointer.

@2@ Sets the associated stream buffer to {{c|sb}}. The error state is cleared by calling {{lc|clear()}}. Returns the associated stream buffer before the operation. If there is no associated stream buffer, returns a null pointer.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|sb|Stream buffer to associate to.}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
The associated stream buffer, or a null pointer if there was no associated stream buffer.

{{cpp/impldef exception}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;sstream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::ostringstream local;
    auto cout_buff = std::cout.rdbuf(); // save pointer to std::cout buffer

    std::cout.rdbuf(local.rdbuf()); // substitute internal std::cout buffer with
                                    // buffer of 'local' object

    // now std::cout work with 'local' buffer
    // you don't see this message
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "some message";

    // go back to old buffer
    std::cout.rdbuf(cout_buff);

    // you will see this message
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "back to default buffer\n";

    // print 'local' content
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "local content: " &lt;&lt; local.str() &lt;&lt; "\n";
}
|output=
back to default buffer
local content: some message
}}
